com.github.pradyothadavi.annotation

Annotation Type HeaderValue


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface HeaderValue
    See Also:

    This annotation facilitates rate limiting of API based on header information. Using this annotation, you will be able to specify the parameters for rate limiting for the value of the header key mentioned in {@link RateLimitByHeader#header()}

    The annotation supports the following ways of specifying rate limit
    Rate Limiter
    Parameter Comment
    RatePerSecond Numeric Value
    Name Limit A named alias for rate per second which you can read from application configuration.

    Above rate limits are applied for the value of the {@link RateLimitByHeader#header()} which is specifies in {@link #value()}

    * Example : Suppose an API is being accessed by two clients, where the clients are identified based on the header X-Client-Id. Further you are not sure what value to rate limit for client2. Then you can annotate your API as follows

    Path("/ratelimitbyheader") public RateLimitByHeaderDemoResource{ GET RateLimitByHeader(header = "X-Client-Id", rateLimts = { HeaderValue(value = "client1", ratePerSecond = 100), HeaderValue(value = "client2", nameLimit = "client2.rps")}) public Response getSomething(){ ... } }

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String value
      The field captures the value of the header mentioned in RateLimitByHeader.header().

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String nameLimit
      The field captures a named alias for rate limit on a per second.
      double ratePerSecond
      The field captures the rate limit on a per second to be applied on the value captured in value().

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract java.lang.String value
        The field captures the value of the header mentioned in RateLimitByHeader.header(). Specified rate limit would be applied against this value.
        Returns:
        header value as String

      • ratePerSecond

        public abstract double ratePerSecond
        The field captures the rate limit on a per second to be applied on the value captured in value(). This must be a non-negative field.
        Returns:
        rate limit as double.
        Default:
        0.0

      • nameLimit

        public abstract java.lang.String nameLimit
        The field captures a named alias for rate limit on a per second. The value of this field represents the key corresponding to which a rate limit is specified. This field allows you to change the rate limit for an API which redeploying the application. The value corresponding to named alias must be present in the application configuration file.
        Returns:
        named alias for rate limit
        Default:
        ""
